dt: {bc}a pack {dx_def}see {dxt|pack:1||1a}{/dx_def} that usually has two shoulder straps and is carried on the back: such as
{bc}a large pack (as of canvas or nylon) that is supported by an external or internal frame (as of aluminum) and is used especially for carrying supplies when hiking and camping

dt.t: The logistics of the trip required that I carry all my stuff in a {wi}backpack{/wi}. Since I didn't want to lug too heavy a load on the hiking leg of the trip, I pared way down.

dt: {bc}a bag or small pack (as of canvas, polyester, or nylon) used for carrying personal belongings or supplies {bc}{sx|knapsack||}

dt.t: I rode my bicycle to the market and rode home with my {wi}backpack{/wi} full of exotic lettuces and basil-garlic baguettes.
Each morning, tens of thousands of moms load phones, along with homework, into the {wi}backpacks{/wi} of schoolchildren.

dt: {bc}a piece of equipment designed for use while being carried on the back

dt.t: By wearing a jet-propelled "space {wi}backpack{/wi}," astronauts will be able to move freely in space, making it possible to build, repair, and maintain craft in orbit …

I'm soaring above the central Sahara in a powered paraglider, a single-seat aircraft that looks like a flying lawn chair. Developed in France, it combines an inflated, parachute-like wing with a 50-pound motorized {wi}backpack{/wi}.

shortdef: a pack that usually has two shoulder straps and is carried on the back: such as
a large pack (as of canvas or nylon) that is supported by an external or internal frame (as of aluminum) and is used especially for carrying supplies when hiking and camping
a bag or small pack (as of canvas, polyester, or nylon) used for carrying personal belongings or supplies : knapsack

dt: {bc}to carry (food or equipment) on the back especially in hiking

shortdef: to carry (food or equipment) on the back especially in hiking
